steps.name: deep_execution_trace
steps.description: Simulate deepest execution path to uncover bugs and syntax errors
steps.key_question: Are there hidden bugs or inefficiencies?
steps.success: Identified bugs, syntax errors, and improvements

tasks.instruction: Trace each function and command with variable states, simulate edge cases (missing files, network failures, invalid configs), identify syntax errors and runtime issues, and flag areas for improvement (performance, clarity, robustness)
tasks.check: Trace complete, bugs and improvements listed

steps.name: word_by_word_reanalysis
steps.description: Reanalyze every word against documentation for accuracy
steps.key_question: Is every configuration and command accurate?

tasks.instruction: Parse each line and word in scripts and configs, cross-reference with relevant documentation (e.g., man.openbsd.org for OpenBSD), validate daemon behavior and config syntax, and flag discrepancies
Remove redundancies, fix bugs, and apply improvements from execution trace and reanalysis
Package outputs with line count, checksums, guide, feedback, trace, and user preview
Generate feedback prompts, summarize feedback, and suggest enhancements for scores < 7
tasks.check: Prompts generated, score calculated, suggestions actionable

tasks.instruction: Report rule, step, and master.json compliance with trace, score

universal_enforcement.description: Global principles and standards applied to all project types and contexts

single_responsibility.description: Each module/class should have only one reason to change

open_closed.description: Software entities should be open for extension, closed for modification
open_closed.rationale: Promotes extensibility without breaking existing functionality

liskov_substitution.description: Objects of a superclass should be replaceable with objects of its subclasses

interface_segregation.description: No client should be forced to depend on methods it does not use

parametric_design.description: Use configurable, reusable components with clear parameters

input_validation.rationale: Prevents injection attacks and data corruption

output_encoding.rationale: Prevents cross-site scripting and data leakage

least_privilege.rationale: Limits blast radius of security breaches

requirements.code_references: Use ``code`` for inline code, ```language blocks for multi-line
requirements.clarity: Write concisely, avoid unnecessary words, use active voice
requirements.spacing: Use logical line breaks, group related concepts, separate sections clearly
requirements.consistency: Maintain consistent terminology and formatting throughout

communication_standards.rationale: Ensures clear, professional communication across all contexts

unified_validation.description: Single validation checkpoint applying all universal rules regardless of context

global.description: Rules for all stacks - references universal_enforcement for consistent application

rules.text: Define stack-specific execution rules that complement universal enforcement
